title: Search fails occassionally
content:
Sometimes, the keyword-based search returns nothing.

Cause

A possible cause for this issue is that the search is too slow, and the search process breaks down.Â 

Solution

If you haven't changed the timeout values before, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to the control plane node or bastion node, and then run the following command:
    kubectl edit cm itom-sma-smarta-common-configuration-cm -n <namespace>

  2. Find the following fields:

    • hystrix.command.default.execution.isolation.thread.timeoutInMilliseconds

    • itsma.service.httpclient.default.socket-timeout

  3. Increase the timeout values for these two fields. For example, increase the value from 3000 to 4000.
  4. Restart the Smart Analytics service by using the following command:
    kubectl rollout restart deployment smarta-search -n itsma-xceej

If you have changed the timeout values before updating the suite to the new version, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to the control plane node or bastion node, and then run the following command:
    kubectl edit deployment -n itsma-xceej smarta-search
  2. Check the following fields:
    • hystrix.command.default.execution.isolation.thread.timeoutInMilliseconds
    • itsma.service.httpclient.default.socket-timeout
    Note: If previously you only changed one value, you will find only one field here.

  3. Note down all the timeout values you previously changed.

  4. After you upgrade the suite to the new version, log in to the control plane node or bastion node, and then run the following command:
    kubectl edit cm itom-sma-smarta-common-configuration-cm -n <namespace>

  5. Find the following fields:

    • hystrix.command.default.execution.isolation.thread.timeoutInMilliseconds

    • itsma.service.httpclient.default.socket-timeout

  6. Update the timeout values with the ones you noted down.
  7. Restart the Smart Analytics service by using the following command:
    kubectl rollout restart deployment smarta-search -n itsma-xceej
